title: Dandelion with Potatoes
introduction: Dandelion with Potatoes is a delightful dish that combines the slightly bitter taste of dandelion greens with the soft texture of waxy potatoes. Enhanced with a touch of garlic and a splash of white wine vinegar, the flavors come together in a harmonious blend that's both comforting and revitalizing. Whether you use kale or chard as substitutes, the essence of this dish remains a healthy and flavorful option for any meal.
ingredients: 6 small waxy potatoes, peeled and sliced
instructions: Trim the dandelion and discard any bruised leaves. Cut off the stem ends. Separate the leaves and wash well in cool water, especially in the center of the leaves where soil collects. Cut the leaves crosswise into bite-size pieces.
Bring about 4 quarts of water to a boil. Add the potato slices, dandelion, and salt to taste. Bring the water back to the boil and cook until the vegetables are tender, about 10 minutes. Drain well.
In a large skillet, cook the garlic in the oil until golden, about 2 minutes. Add the vegetables, vinegar, and a pinch of salt. Cook, stirring well, until heated through, about 2 minutes. Serve hot.
variations: Substitute kale or chard for the dandelion greens.
